description: {"blocks":[{"key":"86ds8","text":"The protocol describes how to perform neurophysiological imaging experiments on different types of human iPSC-derived neurons.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"1oae5","text":"Solutions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkfdv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9g8c9","text":"HEPES buffer consists of: (in mM) 140 NaCl, 5 KCl, 10 HEPES, 2 CaCl2, 2 MgCl2, and 10 d-glucose, adjusted to pH = 7.4 using NaOH (Li et al. 2022).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":67,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":76,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":130,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"afd1i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abv10","text":"Electrodes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1vrv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3eo","text":"Focal electrodes were constructed by soldering a 50 µm tungsten wire to a gold connector inserted into a glass pipette that was pulled using a Sutter instruments pipette puller. The tip of the glass pipetted was sealed by melting the glass in the open flame of a lighter. This electrode was connected to a Grass stimulator and (30V) pulses were given at 1-20 Hz. A silver electrode was used as a reference electrode. (Li et al. 2019) ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":418,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"aq8lb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0jcb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"731gg","text":"For field stimulation:  two Pt wire electrodes (0.5 mm diameter) were flatted and cut to from two planar side which were spaced 1 mm apart in a plexiglass rod. This rod was positioned using a Narishige 3D manipulator such that the 1 mm space covered the field of view that was under investigation. The electrode was gently put on the coverslip and current (5-10 mA) stimuli were given to depolarize the neuronal networks. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2e2ct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"81E0DF301F2911EE81DA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1152/ajpgi.00162.2022"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9886A40A1F2911EE81DA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://doi.org/10.7554/eLife.42914"}}}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"8dclr","text":"Barber at al. 2019","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":18}],"data":{}},{"key":"3rdr5","text":"Boesmans et al. 2019","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":20}],"data":{}},{"key":"e0l11","text":"Kriks et al. 2011","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":17}],"data":{}},{"key":"vati","text":"Li et al. 2019","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"6gp3m","text":"Li et al. 2022","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"704rc","text":"Van Steenbergen et al. 2022","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":0,"length":27}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5FDFB7E91F2911EE81DA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6548871/"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"632AC8291F2911EE81DA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://doi.org/10.1002/glia.23596"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B3CEA0001F2811EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/nature10648"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6936A3BF1F2911EE81DA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://doi.org/10.7554/eLife.42914"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6E34CD361F2911EE81DA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1152/ajpgi.00162.2022"}},"5":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1B7CCD741F2911EE81DA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.2203499119"}}}}

status.info: The protocol works but we are still developing and optimizing this protocol.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8fo1o","text":"Cells were differentiated from human iPSCs (WTC11, KOLF2.1 cell lines) according to published protocols, with some modifications to allow for easier live-cell imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6a0nk","text":"The iPSC cell lines (WTC11 and KOLF2.1J) are cultured in Essential 8 medium on Geltrex-coated plates. The cultures are passaged every 3 days with 0.5mM EDTA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ajnl","text":"To generate midbrain dopaminergic-like neurons, we followed the Kriks et al. (2011) protocol, with the following modifications:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"djooe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6066v","text":"Simplified basal medium: ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19ll2","text":"Days 1-20: Neurobasal-A + 1% GlutaMAX + 2% B27 Supplement + 1% N2 Supplement + 1% PenStrep","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq4ob","text":"Days 20+: Neurobasal-A + 1% GlutaMAX + 2% B27 Supplement + 1% PenStrep","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dplft","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clbug","text":"Additional 1:2 replating step at Day 8 of differentiation to avoid cell detachment due to overgrowth.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"13ljl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0uff","text":"For the replating step at Day 20, the cells are replated under low-density conditions (30 x103 - 100 x103 cells per cm2) as opposed to the recommended high-density conditions (300 x103 - 400 x103 cells per cm2)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":93,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":104,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":118,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":183,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":194,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":208,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cufpo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fllj5","text":"If there are non-neuronal cells present in the culture after Day 20, a treatment with 2 µM Ara-C for 24-48h is carried out.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DB250C4B1B4011EE81B70A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://doi.org/10.1038/nature10648"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g2mm","text":"To generate enteric nervous system-like neurons, we followed the Barber et al. (2019) protocol, with the following modifications:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":20}],"data":{}},{"key":"6moe1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fstrr","text":"Additional replating step at Day 20-22. We plate 60 x103 - 100 x103 cells per cm2.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":55,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":66,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":80,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9uanb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ci7p1","text":"If there are non-neuronal cells present in the culture after Day 20, a treatment with 2 µM Ara-C for 24-48h is carried out.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"95FF88401B4111EEAB04C373C36385CB","url":"http://doi.org/10.1038/s41596-019-0141-y"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ergmq","text":"Using calcium as a proxy for neuronal activity, we assess calcium dynamics during basal conditions, as well as during stimulations. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cl78e","text":"For midbrain dopaminergic-like neurons:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ldra","text":"The cells are loaded with the calcium dye Fluo-4-AM at a concentration of    for   at  . ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":74,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":81,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":86,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"11nno","text":"The cells are washed 3x with HEPES and left to incubate at  for  .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9fst6","text":"The coverslips are mounted into an imaging holder and the cells covered with HEPES. As an easy alternative, glass bottom culture dishes can be used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mbco","text":"The cells can be imaged for up to  .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1jji","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"50-100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"2574E7901F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":30}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"0D1DAC401F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"13FF25C01F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"36DA2EA01F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"3C636B201F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"5":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"477E48901F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"588ke","text":"For ENS-like neurons:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nanu","text":"The cells are loaded with the calcium dye Fluo-4-AM at a concentration of   for   at  , on a shaker (\u003c50 rpm). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":74,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":80,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2gnsk","text":"The cells are washed 1x with HEPES and mounted into an imaging holder. The cells are covered with HEPES. As an easy alternative, glass bottom dishes can be used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16nna","text":"The cells can be imaged for up to  .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"99ns5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"509C6BA01F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"5B0537201F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"5DCA4A901F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"664131201F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bmmmp","text":"Using mitochondrial dyes such as MitoTracker (MitoTracker Green/Red/Red CMXRos), we investigate neuritic mitochondrial transport in these cells (Van Steenbergen et al. 2022).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":145,"length":27}],"data":{}},{"key":"f5n40","text":"The cells are loaded in   (for dopaminergic-like neurons) or   (for ENS-like neurons) MitoTracker for   at  . ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":23,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":61,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":102,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":107,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ul0e","text":"The cells are washed 3x with HEPES and left to incubate at   for  .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":59,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cpap","text":"The coverslips are mounted onto an imaging holder and covered with HEPES. As an easy alternative, glass bottom culture dishes can be used.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vvug","text":"The cells can be imaged for up to .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":33,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"52559C101F2411EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","url":"http://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.2203499119"}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"5-7.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"716C62401F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":30}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"20","error_concentration":false,"guid":"7BAA74401F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":30}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"85E4B5B01F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"87C360C01F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"5":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8C8332C01F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"6":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"936FA8C01F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"7":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"97249A701F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2kopd","text":"Local perfusion (for ENS-like cells, as in Boesmans et al. 2019)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":20}],"data":{}},{"key":"3a4o","text":"High-K+ ( )","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":6,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7r1i9","text":"Substance P ( ) ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":13,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4tvnf","text":"DMPP ( )","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"91usu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hvgc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0B5E1EC01F2611EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","url":"http://doi.org/10.1002/glia.23596"}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"75","error_concentration":false,"guid":"A8EAC6301F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"B344C4A01F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"BCD04F801F2A11EEBB10EF5F3B1310AB","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1vkc8","text":"Electrical stimulation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1n677","text":"Electrodes (custom field electrodes and focal electrodes; see Materials for details)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atp6c","text":"Stimulator: Master8 (A.M.P.I) driving the A385 Stimulus Isolator (World Precision Instruments)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1s80","text":"Stimulation protocols:","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cmtt","text":"        ‣ Field electrode ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9e3kq","text":"            • 3 - 100 pulses at 20 Hz - 100 Hz","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cskr0","text":"            • Current: 5 - 10 mA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqt7a","text":"        ‣ Focal electrode","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9c5l6","text":"            • Train duration: 2x1000 ms","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6osg","text":"            • Rate: 2x10 pps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csptc","text":"            • Delay: 1x1ms","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52m1p","text":"            • Duration: 3x0.1 ms","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2rvu","text":"            • Volts: 3x10 volts","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ss0r","text":"Depending on the experiment, we use a combination of different stimuli to assess neuronal physiology.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8i2o","text":"A variety of microscopes can be used. We use wide-field systems (Zeiss Axiovert, Nikon coupled to Till Vision image acquisition hard/software) and confocal systems (Zeiss LSM 780-NLO, Zeiss LSM 880 AiryScan). The image acquisition speed should be at least 1-2 Hz in order to capture the relevant physiological events.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4edju","text":"\nLaser powers and exposure times (generally ~ 2 mWatt for widefield, 20-80ms exposure per 500 ms) should be adjusted to avoid bleaching and to preserve neuronal health. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Protocol for neurophysiological imaging in human iPSC-derived neurons
